citeinfo.title: Chaco Culture National Historical Park Vegetation Mapping Project - Park Boundary

descript.abstract: This is a vector polygon file showing the administrative boundaries of the Chaco Canyon, Pueblo Pintado, Kin Yaa and Kin Bineola park units of Chaco Culture National Historical Park. This dataset is a composite of two park boundary shapefiles acquired from the NPS data store: CHCU_BoundaryArea_2007.shp and Past_Boundary_Poly.shp. The coordinates for these datasets were heads up digitized using ArcMap GIS Software.
descript.purpose: To show the location of the Chaco Culture National Historical Park administrative boundaries and provide a working boundary for the vegetation map. The intended use of all data in the park's GIS library is to support diverse park activities including planning, management, maintenance, research, and interpretation.
descript.supplinf: The shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

theme.themekt: National Park Service Theme Category Thesaurus

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Southern Colorado Plateau Network

cntinfo.hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. MST Monday thru Friday

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

attracc.attraccr: The attribute accuracy was tested by interactively querying and verifying on screen with the source materials. In addition, the attributes were compared against a master set of valid attributes.

dataqual.logic: There are no duplicate features present. Polygon features (if present) begin and end at the same point.
dataqual.complete: This data was complete at the time of its collection.

horizpa.horizpar: Estimated accuracies in the X and Y direction of 1 to 20 meters from the true location. The horizontal positional accuracy was tested by verifying the location of the data on-screen relative to the corresponding 1:24000 USGS DRG (digital raster graph) in the same projection and datum. The relative positions between the two datasets onscreen was compared to the hardcopy map used as the base for digitizing.

citeinfo.origin: Chaco Culture National Historical Park, National Park Service
citeinfo.title: Current Pueblo Pintado Boundary Polygon in Chaco Culture National Historical Park, NM
citeinfo.othercit: Heads up digitized polygons from USGS 1:24000 topo. Created by Brad_Shattuck@nps.gov All features were verified onscreen.

srcinfo.srccontr: Provided administrative boundaries for the Chaco Canyon, Kin Bineola, and Kin Ya'a park units.

citeinfo.origin: Chaco Culture National Historical Park, National Park Service
citeinfo.title: Pueblo Pintado Past Boundary Polygon in Chaco Culture National Historical Park, NM
citeinfo.othercit: Heads up digitzed from USGS 1:24000 topo by Brad_Shattuck@nps.gov All features were verified onscreen.

srcinfo.srccontr: Provided the administrative boundary for the Pueblo Pintado park unit.

procstep.procdesc: Added the USGS Topo into ArcMap Software. Created a new polygon dataset. Using the graphics drawing tools available, sketched new features into the dataset based on prior knowledge of the area shown in the background. Created user defined fields in the feature's attribute table. Interactively populated the fields based on prior knowledge of the features. All features and attributes were verified onscreen.

cntorgp.cntorg: National Park Service, Southern Colorado Plateau Network

cntinfo.hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. MST Monday thru Friday

procstep.procdesc: Added two boundary shapefiles, CHCU_BoundaryArea_2007 and Past_Boundary_Poly, into ArcMap. Deleted the polygon representing the Pueblo Pintado unit from the CHCU_Boundary_2007 shapefile in an edit session using Arc Editor. Combined the CHCU_BoundaryArea_2007.shp and Past_Boundary_Poly.shp files into a single shapefile using the merge tool in ArcToolbox.

The attribute table was updated in the newly created shapefile, including the Name, Perimeter and Area fields. The Area_acres and Perimeter calculations were verified. Feature data was compared to features in the digital raster graph and/or digital orthophoto quarter quads for accuracy. GIS personnel verified all features and attributes.
The Shapefile was imported into a geodatabase by the USGS/CSS/Core Science Analytics and Synthesis.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Name of the National Park unit.
Location of the National Park unit.
2-letter abbreviation of state in which park occurs (or mostly occurs if park spans more than one state)

overview.eaover: The first 4 items in the attribute table are the default attribute information found in the ArcView shapefile format.
overview.eadetcit: The user-defined items and values are described in detail above. Contact ESRI (Environmental Systems Research Institute, Inc.) for detailed explanations of their internal file structure at "http://www.esri.com". Contact Trimble at http://www.trimble.com" for a more detailed explanation of generated attributes that can be exported for feature type.

It is the responsibility of the data user to use the data appropriately and consistent within the limitations of geospatial data in general and these data in particular. Any related graphics (if available) are intended to aid the data user in acquiring relevant data; it is not approriate to use the related graphics as data.
The U.S. Geological Survey and the National Park Service gives no warranty, expressed or implied, as to the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of these data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from an U.S. Geological Survey and National Park Service servers and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the utility of the data on another system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. Mention of trade names or commercial products in this metadata report does not constitute endorsement or recommendation for use by the U. S. Department of the Interior, U. S. Geological Survey and National Park Service.
